tweets.text: @SianieRoo @EnvAgency The good news is you are in one @StinkStopthe we are here for each other and our friends throughout the UK.

@SarahInNUL @poppers82 @AaronBell4NUL @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe It's disgusting how this place is still allowed to operate without closer EA scrutiny. Is something underhand going on?

@Laura_James88 @RedIndustries2 Hi Laura hopefully you're also reporting on the toxic fumes nightmare that residents are living through because of the @WalleysL landfill site. @RedIndustries2 have been found in breach of permits by the @EnvAgency but residents continue to inhale toxic H2S fumes daily
@Tus_M_

This flower may look pretty from a distanceüå∏, but don‚Äôt be fooled ü§îit‚Äôs an #invasivespecies. 

Himalayan Balsam shades out native species and promotes erosion on riverbanks.

For more info on the species visit: https://t.co/vvVEGcBlGh https://t.co/6Xd4kZT0st

A community in Staffordshire are living with doors & windows taped up.Nose bleeds, breathing issues, toxic fumes from the landfill site @WalleysL run by @RedIndustries2  The @EnvAgency have found the company  'in breach' but v little action #socialjustice  https://t.co/DehURqq0oi

tweets.text: I just made my first complaint to the @ICOnews, as the @EnvAgency has failed to give me a proper response *four and a half months* after I made my initial Environmental Information Regulations request. It's supposed to respond within 20 working days. It's been 97. @CampaignFoI.

What?! The @EnvAgency asking if you‚Äôd like to join a support group because you‚Äôre at the end of your tether due to their inaction allowing landfill gas to continue to assault you every night?! Unbelievable ü§£#stopthestink https://t.co/SOciOJOTV0
@SianieRoo @EnvAgency Indeed!! https://t.co/vdaKOPLLwl

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA are you joking? You need to learn a huge amount about community health from the people of Newcastle under Lyme. Stop talking and get the landfill close down. #StopTheStink #EnvironmentalDisaster #PublicHealthEmergency #WalleysQuarry @BorisJohnson @JuliaBradbury

@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids It stunk over 3.5 miles away in Hanford last night, seems to be  just as bad as before the "capping" .

tweets.text:
Floating pennywort is an invasive plant that costs the economy at least ¬£25 million a year.

To tackle this, we have teamed up with @AnglingTrust, @BritishCanoeing and an army of local volunteers, to leave floating pennywort with nowhere to hide. 

‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/NCESUYazJc https://t.co/YpvN7pBbbo

Newcastle-under-Lyme MP @AaronBell4NUL has told the Commons he believes his constituency is suffering with a public health emergency. 

The Conservative MP says the situation from Walleys Quarry landfill has worsened further in an adjournment debate.

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency You're still allowing us to be poisoned by hydrogen sulphide though aren't you James. Even with overwhelming evidence that is causing ill health, you're still doing nothing about it.

tweets.text: It is not getting any better. The gas stink from the landfill is increasing in intensity. A dreadful weekend and again tonight. No one should have to live like this. We are all looking for answers from @EnvAgencyMids and light at the end of this tunnel. @StinkStopthe https://t.co/JPdHJZJBqQ

I've seen the stink from Walley's reported from inside Newcastle-under-Lyme @vuecinemas this evening as well as in other town centre locations.

This is exactly what was feared - why on earth weren't the additional requirements of the operator identified earlier? @EnvAgency
@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA https://t.co/gbGZKVzjsq
